discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -40,6 +40,10 @@ executors:
     docker:
       - image: ubuntu:latest
     resource_class: small
+  circle-go:
+    docker:
+      - image: cimg/go:1.20
discussion_comments.comment_body: Can we use the `go_version` parameter above for this? `cimg/go` publishes on each patch version of the go toolchain, so it should work.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -40,6 +40,10 @@ executors:
     docker:
       - image: ubuntu:latest
     resource_class: small
+  circle-go:
+    docker:
+      - image: cimg/go:1.20
discussion_comments.comment_body:
We could do that, but it would take us out of alignment with the go version in the Dockerfile:
https://github.com/snyk/cli/blob/main/.circleci/Dockerfile#L1

commented_code:
name: Configuring artifact
           command: << parameters.test_snyk_command >> config set "api=${SNYK_API_KEY}"

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -279,139 +543,142 @@ jobs:
           name: Configuring artifact
           command: << parameters.test_snyk_command >> config set "api=${SNYK_API_KEY}"
discussion_comments.comment_body:
suggestion: the `SNYK_API_KEY` used here will pollute our `platform_hammerhead` org when `snyk monitor` acceptance tests are ran.

we should use the dedicated testing org here (and for all test jobs really) to avoid this. The test org should be available in the in `team_hammerhead-cli` context.

Because the documentation says so.
> Update all NodeJS versions to match the NodeJS versions used in pkg.
